intro: Ardisia nigromaculata, commonly known as the black-spotted ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myricaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with distinctive black spots. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by dark red berries. It thrives in shady, moist environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. The berries are an important food source for various birds and small mammals.
